article.headline: Sacred Heart 77, LIU Brooklyn 74
article.story: FAIRFIELD, Conn. (AP) -- Center Kibwe Trim scored 19 points and grabbed seven rebounds to lead Sacred Heart University to a 77-74 win over Long Island University on Saturday. It ended a five-game losing streak for the Pioneers (4-20, 3-12), which oustscored the Blackbirds in the paint 40-10. LIU (11-14, 8-8) came within three at 23-20 with 8:35 remaining in the first half. Scores by Drew Shubik and Gene Pettway had the Pioneers back up by four, then two more lay-ups and a free throw by Trim put Sacred Heart ahead 34-22 with 4:23 left in the half. Guard James Williams led LIU in scoring with 21 points. Esa Maki-Tulokas added 13 and Jones finished with 12.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
